assetHeadline: Disastrous 14 hours for Labour after 2017 manifesto leak
message: Is there really anything crazy about having an NHS and an education system that work? It makes sense to me.

assetHeadline: Disastrous 14 hours for Labour after 2017 manifesto leak
message: I hardly think he can be blamed for the BBC camera man getting in the way of a car, the camera man was acting like a blood paparazzi. As the old saying goes, play stupid games, win stupid prizes, now the British tax payer has to fork out twice for that fools massive salary and his health care.

assetHeadline: Disastrous 14 hours for Labour after 2017 manifesto leak
message:
Ah the 1970's

When you could retire at 65, afford to buy a house, had a pension to look forward to, university was free & the NHS was funded. 

Sounds awful. No wonder the Tories hate it.

assetHeadline: Disastrous 14 hours for Labour after 2017 manifesto leak

comments.assetHeadline: Disastrous 14 hours for Labour after 2017 manifesto leak
comments.message:
for someone who isn't strong, he's been on the right side of history for 30+ years, often voting against the grain (iraq war) and meeting hundreds of people almost every day and happily taking their questions. Theresa May on the other hand has been on the wrong side of history, she can't even bring herself to meet the general public for unscripted talks and questions, name calling and picking fights with EU is not STRONG AND STABLE.

one more thing, the mainstream media have launched an ceaseless offensive on Corbyn ever since he took leadership and yet he still stands tall because he knows that his responsibility is to represent the people as opposed to his party (like Theresa)

comments.assetHeadline: Disastrous 14 hours for Labour after 2017 manifesto leak
comments.message: Repeat after me.Strong and Stable Strong and Stable Strong and Stable Strong and Stable Strong and Stable Strong and Stable Strong and Stable Strong and Stable Strong and Stable repeat it often enough and any IDIOT will believe it and they do...

message: The man is a total joke. British politics is in the gutter if this is the strongest candidate to run the second biggest party. Strong leadership comes from strong opposition and he is certainly not that.

assetHeadline: Disastrous 14 hours for Labour after 2017 manifesto leak
message:
When May was Home Secretary, she cut police numbers by 20%. 

So when your house gets burgled, or some lout punches you in the street, but no one comes to deal with it, you know who to blame. 

When she becomes an elected PM, what other crap do you think she is going to pull?
